greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1)=a(2)=a(3)=a(4)=1; thereafter a(n) = gpf(a(n-1)+a(n-2)+a(n-3)+a(n-4)), where gpf is the greatest prime factor.
comment: After 133 steps, enters a cycle of length 14.
link: Greg Back and Mihai Caragiu, The Greatest Prime Factor and Recurrent Sequences, Fibonacci Quart. 48 (2010), no. 4, 358-362.
mathematica: nxt[{a_,b_,c_,d_}]:={b,c,d,FactorInteger[a+b+c+d][[-1,1]]}; Transpose[ NestList[ nxt,{1,1,1,1},120]][[1]] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Sep 24 2013 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 18 2010
